text: Is there an opposite to 'icontains'? i.e. for does not contain?
I think I've answered my own question with 'not_like'... I don't think it's the exact inverse but does the job I need it to
When filtering table rows using multiple criteria, is it possible to change the logic from *"criteria 1" `AND` "criteria 2"* to *"criteria 1" `OR` "criteria 2"*?
The API doesn't support or, and the hubl function uses the API filtering.
Why in HubDB can a richtext field not do line over line without spaces between? This is super frustrating to our content marketers and even worse for Dynamic Pages.
It is, but it you know itâ€™s a URL so you can link with it rather than figuring this out by column name.
You can emulate ORs using the `in` operator with certain column types. See the bottom of <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows>
Except for the `in` operator. See the bottom of <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows>
